pageContext.surface: Bright metal, with green corrosive spots and thick corrosion on one side of edge.
pageContext.associations: Part of a hoard consisting of 16 flanged celts, 3 daggers and a spearhead and chisel.
pageContext.publications: Evans, J., Ancient bronze implements, 50, 51, 165, 241, 259, 464.,Arch. Journ. XXVI, 346, Where the scale given is erroneous.
pageContext.collection: British Museum, 69.12-20.3,Given by the Duke of Bedford, 1869.
pageContext.site: England,Devonshire,Plymstock,about a mile east of Preston, beneath a flat stone at a depth of two feet.
